intro: Saurauia javanica, commonly known as the Javan mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or pink flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Saurauia javanica plays an ecological role in its habitat by contributing to the food web and influencing forest dynamics.
